meanings.definition: To lift or haul with great effort
meanings.sent1: She heaved the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The workers heaved the bags of cement onto the truck.
meanings.sent3: After heaving the suitcase up the stairs, she realized she forgot her keys.
meanings.sent4: The storm heaved the waves against the shore with great force.
meanings.sent5: With a loud grunt, he heaved the boulder out of the way.

meanings.sent1: He heaved the ball across the field to his teammate.
meanings.sent2: The angry player heaved his racket in frustration.
meanings.sent3: She heaved the snowball at her brother, hitting him square in the face.
meanings.sent4: The chef heaved the dough into the air to stretch it out.
meanings.sent5: The pirate heaved the treasure chest overboard to hide it from other sailors.

meanings.definition: To rise and fall rhythmically, as in breathing or waves
meanings.sent1: The dog heaved a contented sigh as it lay in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The ocean heaved gently under the moonlight.
meanings.sent3: The old ship heaved with each passing wave, creaking in protest.
meanings.sent4: The exhausted runner heaved for breath after finishing the race.
meanings.sent5: The baby heaved a little giggle before falling asleep.
